text:
Salvatore Farina (born November 18, 1957) is an Italian Army general. He is the current Chief of Army Staff. He was commander of the Kosovo Force, the military attaché at the Embassy of Italy, London and as the commander of Allied Joint Force Command Brunssum.
On 8 March 2020, he had tested positive for SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes coronavirus disease 2019.
